author: Charlotte Roueché

organization.description:
Open Archaeology. See the [Working Group on Open Data in Archaeology](http://wiki.okfn.org/wg/archaeology) for more details.

Please note that only open data should be added to this group. Data to enquiry may be tagged "archaeology".

### Metadata

See <http://wiki.osgeo.org/wiki/Location_in_CKAN> for the proposed metadata for both spatial and temporal dimensions. Basically, use meaningful tags.
organization.title: Open Archaeology
organization.name: archaeology

name: aphrodisias-late-antiquity
notes:
From the website:

> This is the electronic second edition, expanded and revised from the version published by the Society for the Promotion of Roman Studies in 1989. The editions and commentary are by Charlotte Roueché, except for Text 1, by Joyce Reynolds. The electronic editorial conventions were developed by Tom Elliott (EpiDoc), and the website and the supporting materials are the work of Gabriel Bodard, Paul Spence, and colleagues at King's.
title: Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity: The Late Roman and Byzantine Inscriptions
